content:
I have used several online learning apps and this one is by far the best. It gives you interesting problems to work through immediately. Everything is sequential and makes sense. They remove all the friction from having to juggle multiple environments. Great work!

Edit, 5 months later: I now have over 70 hours of DataCamp training. I absolutely recommend the service, however the mobile application lags far behind the web application. There is limited ability to learn through this app‚Äî there are only a handful of courses on the mobile app, where the web app has hundreds.  Hopefully they will continue to add new courses to the mobile platform as time goes on. 

Edit 2: they fixed a bug that erased daily challenge progress the day after I reported it. I am therefore adding a star to the rating.
title: Awesome DataScience App

content:
I have less than minimal coding experience, but I found it easy to jump right into the lessons. They are abbreviated which makes it easy to get a lesson in during short breaks at work, while waiting on an order at a drive thru etc. Because I know the lessons are short and easy, I‚Äôm more motivated to do at least one lesson everyday which is good for someone like me who has a hard time building consistency.

I‚Äôve only been using the app for a week but I believe the regular exposure and gradual build-up of knowledge will help to prepare me for a data analytics boot camp that I plan to enroll in at the beginning of 2020.
title: Great for beginners

content: The methodology of this education is a great tool, I feel the data language seeping In slowly. I knew nothing when I started and I‚Äôm very impressed thus far and excited to continue. Any support for this platform I believe would support the progression of mankind. Machine Learning is the future and so is datacamp. Given what is happening to our educational system since the virus secondary methods of online eductation are key to keeping your kids educated. I recommend DataCamp as a tool that teaches you the tools of the future.
title: The Future of Education

content:
I mainly use the app on my phone to browse and watch videos. However I‚Äôve found quite a few things annoying about the app. 
1) There is no full screen mode option. So if you glaze the edge of your screen at any point while viewing, the video will terminate. 
2) there is no fast forward or backward buttons. If you slightly press the wrong location on the bar to move the video to a new position then it‚Äôs game over, due to the reasons described above. 
3) videos do not retain positional memory. If you accidentally exit the video its game over. You‚Äôll have to manually find where you left off. 
4) there is often poor retention of the position you left the app. I have to search quite a while to find where I left off quite often. 

Again, the content is great. The app is just in need of a bit of work. Thanks
title: App on iPhone 12 is rather miserable despite great content

content: Datacamp is a fantastically designed app and program for learning data science! The lessons are sorry and to the point, but the practice questions really push you to apply what you learn. Also, their customer service is amazing! I won't go in to detail, but I'll say this: they took me as a month to month subscriber to an annual, just by the way they treated me!
title: Amazing Service and a Fantastic App!

content:
Update: this issue has been resolved and the app works most of the time.

I have used this app for many months with no issues and have enjoyed it, but after the new app update and iOS update, it crashes every time I try to open it to continue my daily streak. Nothing shows up and it just crashes. I also tried restarting my phone but that didn‚Äôt help.
title: [Fixed] App Crashing Immediately

content: I am a PhD student in Earth and Environmental Sciences and this app was fundamental to me learning python. The beginner lessons are very well done and accessible to all! I also really appreciate the ‚Äústreaks‚Äù and the daily practices. They ‚Äúgamify‚Äù the daily challenges and it really helps and is fun to keep up a daily streak! Thanks so much for developing a great app. I recommend it to everyone who asks how to get started with python.
title: The Best Way To Get Started Coding!

content: I got started with DataCamp as part of a statistics course in college several years ago, and have continued to use it ever since as a way to keep skills sharp, learn new skills, and maintain a habit of learning and testing my knowledge. Highly recommend for its ease of use and quality of content
title: Amazing resource

content: DataCamp is great. Tons of wonderful content and instructors. But the app is a disappointment. You can‚Äôt access 95% of the courses (I‚Äôm spitballing). The Review feature is nice I guess and a better use of your time than Facebook, but it feels gimmicky. Again, only a few courses or modified courses are on the app. I know it‚Äôs hard to replicate the script editor on mobile, but the app is kind of a let down compared to the great content and interface of the browser based site.
title: Gimmicky App

content: I have fun learning with this daily. I hope practice quizzes are added for even more courses. I also like the "today's challenge" feature. As a feature request, I would like for all the practices I have completed to appear as options for "today's challenge."
title: Great for daily practice!

content: The app is amazing. It has most of the functionality of the website, which is cool. My only gripe is that sometimes the app resets daily challenge streaks even if you didn‚Äôt miss a challenge. That is frustrating. Fortunately, that is the only issue I‚Äôve had. I still recommend the app.
title: Awesome App!

content: I have never coded in my life. Iv seen it but I thought I didn‚Äôt have the capacity to learn it. Data camp breaks it down from start to end with amazing video instruction and explanation. I‚Äôm enjoying it and can‚Äôt wait to see what I can do with it. I would recommend this to anyone who has never coded and wants to learn.

content: For mobile there is nothing better. These videos are concise and challenges achievable. I‚Äôve applied many of the lessons to me actual work at my job. Love this product!

content: The app is useless after you complete basic courses. Most of the courses are not available via the app and also don‚Äôt play when on the web via phone. It pretty much forces you to do the courses on your computer which makes accessibility quite lacking. I‚Äôm pretty disappointed with the app.

content: I may not want to complete my courses on my phone, but the ux is so good, I use it when my laptop is not available. The practice challenges are the best I have experienced offering bite size refreshers of the learned material.üëç

content: I just started the SQL track and I love the exercise-based learning. The daily challenge is a super cool way to keep me practicing. Learning these skills just takes time and practice and this app makes it fun, easy, and efficient.
title: Awesome way to learn

content:
I think this is a great resource, especially for those that use so many different data languages that they need to refresh occasionally; Me.

While this is great for on-the-go, whether that‚Äôs commuting on public transit or while traveling, I‚Äôm disappointed with the iPad experience.

Not being able to utilize the standard Apple folio keyboard with this app because of the forced vertical UI for the mobile courses, is very unfortunate. We‚Äôre in a time where laptop-tablet hybrids are becoming the norm.

To not have a standard landscape UI for iPad available apps is silly.
title: Not a great iPad UI design

content: Maybe the app isn‚Äôt made to work on iPhone 6s or something, but I have to keep closing it snd reopening it. After a screen or two, it stops letting me click on anything. I can‚Äôt proceed with the exercises until I close the app and reopen it, which I have to do over and over to make any progress.
title: Interactivity doesn‚Äôt work consistently

content: The app interface is clean and linking to your web based progress is great, however, 3 stars for two reasons. First, only Python is interactive (meaning it will track progress between devices) and second, only portrait mode is supported on the iPad at this time.
title: Landscape mode for iPad and SQL Interactive

content: This app makes is super entertaining and intuitive to upkeep whichever coding skills you may already possess. Switch 3minutes of snooping around on social media for datacamp‚Äôs quick exercises.

content:
My experience with learning theories and working in the language learning and education field for 10+ years has helped me see what makes for effective learning. If you want to learn these languages, you need constant and spaced reviews. This app is essential. 

In terms put how the app functions-it works fabulously. Great functionality and user interface. The tracking feature helps you get momentum and track your work. 

I do wish the exercises were a little more challenging, meaning I wish they challenged users to recall and remember before providing answer choices. Multiple choice is how many review methods work. The problem is, when facing these questions and challenges in the real world you don‚Äôt have multiple choice. You want to strike a balance between stimulating reality and not making it to challenging. A good middle ground is asking users to think of what to do for a few moments before showing the options. The more the brain is working the more learning and recall is being reinforced. On the other hand, we often have a false sense of learning when we read over what we already know. It‚Äôs the feeling of reviewing but learners in that state aren‚Äôt really engaging or learning/remembering as much as they could. In the end you cannot make someone do this. They either just wait for the multiple choice to come through or choose whatever until they get it right. But still the app can help stimulate good learning practices; e.g. ‚Äúchallenge yourself!‚Äù Another practice that comes to mind is this: after getting a right answer there could be a follow up question - ‚Äúhow confidently did you know this? Swipe up for ‚Äúvery‚Äù down for ‚Äúnot that confident,‚Äù and if users swipe down it asks them to explain it out loud to themselves why it is true...something like that. 

Kaplan‚Äôs GMAT app also has a way of marking a red yellow or green on confidence and keeps the questions in the rotation differently. 

Anyway, a couple ideas. Best wishes!
title: Solid!

content: dc makes learning so easy. i was stuck in my python path but i have progressed alot in only 2 days of intermittent use
title: can you make 10 stars an option.

content: Five stars for DataCamp, but three stars for this app. I get a lot of glitches on my iPad, to the point where I use their mobile website instead. Specifically, I have issues with the menu not appearing and code disappearing. Also, it would be nice to have easier access to slides on the mobile app too.

title: Learn to code quick

content:
Hello DataCamp, you guys are doing a wonderful job in teaching people how to code but force them to use the app instead of the website is completely mad. I have many complaints about the app, and the following would be:
a) Why doesn‚Äôt the app go in landscape orientation ? It is always in portrait mode.
b)  I can not search for the courses? Why I can not search for courses, I just do not get it? People come to DataCamp because of the wealth of knowledge that resides in your courses. If I can not search for courses, what s the point of buying a subscription?
c) The progress doesn‚Äôt sync across all devices, why ? So if I work for 4 hours in office and then what to continue where I left off, on my ipad , it does not even show the course and then I can not even search for the course.

Please make these improvements on your app ASAP or do not force people to use the app instead of the website. 

 ‚Äî     Concerned User
title: User Experience is the Worst

content:
Downloaded this to accompany my 1st annual subscription to Data Camp. 

Although it‚Äôs only a limited curriculum counterpart to the desktop/website, this app provides quick, commute-friendly lessons you can complete from anywhere. Unlimited practice questions build strong retention of the material, plus gamification of learning through Day Streak & points.

My biggest question still is... what do the points mean?! Hoping to see something happen when I hit the 50/100K milestones - Data Camp swag would be cool (hint, hint)...
title: Great bite-sized

content: This app is great when you don‚Äôt have a computer in front of you . It‚Äôs able to give you the basic concepts you will need to code your python. I love it. When I lunch or break at work I go to this app and work on this app. Repetitive skills will help you remember.  Bravo
title: Great
